snippet: The National Center for Drug Free Sport says its programs are stringent enough to deter athletes from doping, but critics question its methods.
abstract: National Center for Drug Free Sport, drug testing company tied to NCAA since 1999, says its programs are stringent enough to deter athletes from doping, but critics question its methods; rate of positive tests has been no higher than 1 percent in any year--despite NCAA survey of student-athletes that indicated at least 1 in 5 used marijuana, banned substance.
lead_paragraph: The National Center for Drug Free Sport says its programs are stringent enough to deter athletes from doping, but critics question its methods.

headline.seo: Drug-Testing Company Tied to N.C.A.A. Draws Criticism
headline.main: Drug-Testing Company Tied to N.C.A.A. Stirs Criticism
headline.print_headline: Drug-Testing Company Tied to N.C.A.A. Stirs Criticism
